title: Hi, this is probably a terrible idea about ranked matchmaking
body:
What if instead of being instantly matched with 4 people (3 for duos) against 5 people, the system was like this.
 

SAME 10 players are matched together BUT 2 of the same role are assigned the duty to assemble teams.
So, they pick their allies of the remaining 8 people. Everyone's main and off role would be visible. And there would be a lobby where people could call "I can also play this".

What would this accomplice

First off, duos who would have to pick their ally or risk losing them would be at a slight disadvantage.
None would say forced 50%.
It would add some more strategy to the game.
It would add the feeling of "playing a sport and picking teams" that riot seems to like.


The entire process would take like 30 seconds or so.



P.S. Obviously this has tons of room for refinement, but you get the jist.

P.s.2. I know this will be unpopular, but can you tell me why you don't want to have something like this with arguments that are not "HUR DUR LOBBY TERRORISTS" "HUR DUR TROLLS" "HURR DUR DODGES"

replies.body:
I don't believe it's great for ranked ladder but its not a bad system for a que type.

I tried to get a group of 10 to show how fast a draft can balance teams. https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/5NHV83dn-science-project-need-bodys

So if you wanna collect some data on it let me know. If I can wrangle a group I am happy to share results.

As you know MM systems are kinda a interest of mine.

Yeah I wish I was in your server to help, but sadly we are in different continents.

I just strongly believe if players had more agency over their team assembling it would help matches be more balanced and less toxic.

For example someone would prioritize getting the best all around players or others would prioritise getting the strongest JG or mid because they believe they need that position to be strong to synergise with them and carry.

And lastly, it would make duoing have actual visible drawbacks. With the added benefit of being able to play AGAINST your duo if it so happens.

> I just strongly believe if players had more agency over their team assembling it would help matches be more balanced and less toxic.

It works but not for 1 off games. Which are the requirement for 24/7 ques. Honor system in custom games is really bad for overall match quality. People lie about skill so you had  weak players in "pros only" And you had very experienced players in "noobs only"  A single 1 off  game would frequently have gross misdistributions of teams.

Which is fine, if your doing a string of games. Because you can readjust the teammates for the next game.  In older years of Leauge I have done this with friends and we have made some pretty great games with large skill gaps in players.

> And lastly, it would make duoing have actual visible drawbacks. With the added benefit of being able to play AGAINST your duo if it so happens

The only fear I have for that is some one soft ints to win trade.

The things I'm contemplating are if its possible to have a Player draft into 5 man teams and if the Club System can be reworked into something to encourage 5 man Premades for Competitive Ranked games.

Mostly trying to find how many ways things can be abused because that's absolutely what will happen if you give folks the opportunity ><

You can't lie about skill if all your stats are there.

Role Winrate, matches played, favored champs, winrate on champs. Etc

The one picking would be able to see it.

Also, this is only for solo/duo queue not for draft.

And if you are duo with someone and want to wintrade, it would be pretty easy for the system to detect that. also, you got no guarantee you won't end up in the same team anyway.

> You can't lie about skill if all your stats are there.

How many Smurfs are People who play for losses to get easier games?

One of the issues I have with "stats" systems in Leauge.. well Mobas in general Is the high level of noise. I don't see a way to build a Training set for a Machine learning program that is not going to have some real Bias issues.

So Main champs and WR are what's likely to remain helpful but Main champions wont help when some one goes off the wall and picks something random.

> Also, this is only for solo/duo queue not for draft.

Make the fleshed out idea. Write out the steps and what's needed to accomplish them. IMO when you try to build something then tear it apart you learn a lot of useful information.

> And if you are duo with someone and want to wintrade, it would be pretty easy for the system to detect that. also, you got no guarantee you won't end up in the same team anyway.

I would shy away from allowing premades in this model personally.  Of topic but I would like to see Riot work on lowering Smurfs in ranked. Targeting the folks who are not looking to win but to pub stomp.  Some one makes a new account and climbs to X rank to prove hey they can do it consistently?  I am ok with that. 

Some one who goes and loses 35 games back to back so they can pub stomp the next 20? Not cool.  55 matches just got trashed for some ones ego impacting up to a max  mix of 495 players with unpredictable negativity.

Why, though?

Nobody would put any thought into picking utter randoms they know nothing about, and it would just be a waste of time and room for more drama/quitting.

Because you would see their stats, rank, champions picked etc when picking.

Similar to what you see with addons, but for all other 9 players
